intro: Coleus excelsus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are usually dark green with striking patterns of silver or purple, adding ornamental value to gardens and indoor spaces. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for both outdoor and indoor cultivation.
